Reviews.Title: “Quaint and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Kit32
Reviews.Content: My recent trip to Rome was my first to Italy and generally I loved it. Hotel Ranieri was very hospitable before the visit in arranging a taxi from the airport to the hotel for me and my friend which we thought was expensive at €55 but probably worth it due to the time we were arriving which was already quite late in the day. We weren’t wrong as we had to wait over an hour for our luggage at Rome airport so if you can go with hand luggage only I’d certainly advise it. The hotel staff spoke very good English thankfully and were extremely friendly and generous with their assistance. They have an amazingly small old fashioned lift which added to the charm of the place. Disappointingly though, the room itself was not big enough to swing a kitten let alone a cat (we had requested a twin and the single beds couldn’t actually separate due to lack of room either side, so it felt like a double anyway). You could just about turn around in the bathroom but it was clean and had everything one would want from a room except space. The walls were quite thin between the rooms as well and we were frequently woken up with corridor noise. The continental breakfast was basic but there was plenty of it. The only thing it really lacked was fresh fruit but it filled the description of a continental breakfast with pastries and cooked meat and eggs as well as cereal and yoghurt each day. The location was good in that the Termini was only a 5 minute walk but we were far enough away from the noise of the main areas at night. I would however, stay slightly more west if I were to visit again so as to make travelling time to the main attractions less. There are not many restaurants or bars around Hotel Ranieri either and although what we did find were some fabulous Italian eateries, I would have preferred to stay somewhere slightly more lively and to have had more choice of restaurants. Getting back to the airport was a doddle from Termini and I would recommend the train which was effortless and easy to buy tickets for at the machines (which both here and on the tube had English translations). We did witness a pick pocketer on the tube though so be vigilant and protective of your belongings. Rome itself seemed to be mostly full of tourists (but we were going to the touristy sites) but with every main site being within walking distance it makes for a great city break. The history and culture was incredibly inspiring. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Torzo
Reviews.Content: A clean pleasent hotel with exceptionally friendly helpful staff. For example when we wanted to book a restaurant a little out of town, Mr.Ranieri himself booked us the table and the taxi so as to make the experience stress free. The hotel is a SHORT walk from the Railway and Bus Station, approximately 10 minutes, where a number of the open top tour buses can be boarded. These are in my opinion the best way to tour Rome allowing the passenger to Hop on and off at all the major attractions thus keeping walking down to whatever suits you. As for restaurants local to the Hotel in the streets directly behind the Hotel there are at least 6 that we found in under 15 minutes. We tried 2 of them and found them to be excellent. The breakfast was fine with enough variety to suit everyone although my only observation would be some sort of toast making facility but that just maybe me. In closing I would say that I wouldn't hesitate to use the Hotel Ranieri again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from Rome last week. We spent 3 nights in the hotel. The staff was very, very nice and helped us get checked into our room upon our arrival at 10:00 am. This was so beneficial after having traveled a very long way and needing a good shower. The rooms were clean and the nice warm breakfast sent us away to see the sights with plenty of energy. I would recommend this hotel! Stephanie

Reviews.Title: “Average in every way”
Reviews.Author: Kirsti H
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ranieri is clean but very average hotel, definitely not four stars but three. It is located in the street where there are hardly any bars and no restaurants - walking back to the hotel late in the evening was rather dull. The reception staff was friendly. The breakfast was a big disappointment - cakes and biscuits were available, but vegetables and fruit were missing totally! A few slices of tomato on a plate, that was all! The omelette was dry and tasteless, the bacon not cooked enough. The coffee came out of a machine and was poor. We had to go and eat out somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good value helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PapaInternational
Reviews.Content: Not far from train station and really helpful staff. Be ready to walk to visit sites though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: taurus14
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Raniieri for six nights and had had very enjoyable stay in this hotel. I stayed in a standard single room which was quite and was good size compared to other hotels. I was in room 212 and I found the room to be very clean and quite. The bathroom was a decent size and modern and clean. The hotel is situated in a lovely building with a lovely old style lift and spiral staiir case. I. found the breakfast to be very nice with a good choice of continental style food, good selection of nice pastries and also a choice of a hot breakfast. The breakfast room was located in the basement area of the hotel but it is a extremely pleasent room decorated iN lovely lemon colour with some lovely antique ceramic vases. The hotel is located in a nice safe area with some nice resturants near by to go to. The Republic Metro station is about a 8 to 10 minute walk away and it is only a few stops away from some of the main sights like the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and about five stops away from Saint Peters and the Vatican museums. Also there is a very extensive bus system in Rome and you can catch buses to most of the main sightseeing areas right across the road from the hotel. You can buy a all day ticket to use on the buses and the two metro lines for 4 Euros which you can buy from the Metro station or at the tabaconists just near to the hotel. Termini station is also only about 10mis away. This is a great hotel if you don't want to be right in the centre of all the action of Rome but close enough that you can chill out after all that wonderful and amazing sightseeing of the city. Staff at the hotel were also very friendly and helpful and the mini bar in the room was very reasonable priced. There is also a little lounge bar where you can get drinks from 24hrs a day. Travelling as a female by myself I felt very safe staying in this hotel and would definetley return again to this hotel when I next have the chance to visit this beautiful city. All in all great find and very reasonably priced. Loved my stay at Hotel Ranieri

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Calliope P
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend spent our christmas vacation in Rome. The hotel was really nice, the staff very friendly and the room great.It was better than we expected from the photos.They changed our tοwels every day. The location very good.Five minutes on foot from the metro station Republica, ten minutes from the Termini and 100 meters from the bus station. The breakfast was great. I surely recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: grogfucious
Reviews.Content: Clean, good service, great location and fairly priced. Australian hotels pay attention because you are arrogant and complacent. Do atrip and find out for yourself what you can get for a AUD OVERSEAS.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was the icing on the cake”
Reviews.Author: Cotehele
Reviews.Content: Having visited Rome with our small travel group several times before and always using the same hotel, it was decided this time that the group would try another hotel. Having scanned numerous hotels on various websites it was decided to use Hotel Ranieri, Via XX Septtembre 43, Via Veneto 00187. As is my practice, I spoke personally to the the hotel before booking and was warmly received. My questions were answered and assurance given as to quality of rooms etc. I booked the reservation on line direct wih the hotel. It was a seamless operation and the reservation was quickly confirmed. Amongst the detailed information sent to me from the hotel was the option to use a private car service to bring us from the airport direct to the hotel. In the past we had made the journey by train and foot. As there were six in the party, it worked out more cost effective to use the service.A six seater vehicle cost 75 Euros for the journey (one way). Having arrived at Fiumicino airport, the driver was waiting for us in the arrivals hall and the journey to the hotel was again a seamless operation. The hotel is typical of hotels in that area, in that the entrance lobby is contained within a small space on the ground floor. We were welcomed to the hotel and dealt with very quickly and efficiently by the reception staff . Despite having arrived way before the alloted booking in time, it was quickly established that our rooms were in fact ready for us and we were able to deposit our bags and start out on our exploration of the city. This hotel is located a little way out from what could be described as the centre of the city, but all the usual visitors sights were within walking distance, such as Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. The rooms are adequate in size and very well appointed. There was air conditioning that worked. The bathroom area was modern and also well appointed. The standard of cleanliness was excellent. The beds were sooo comfortable, and were well received after a long day on the feet! Breakfast is served in a dining room in the basement area . The room was spacious and light and well decorated. There was adequate seating and there was no cause to queue despite the fact that hotel was obviously somewhere near to full. The selection of food was excellent with both hot and continental style available. The staff at reception were exceptionally friendly and never seemed to be worried about all the questions and queries being asked. When it camr for us to return to the airport, the reception staff very efficiently organised the same car service to make the return journey. We were dropped off right outside the terminal we needed which was a godsend as the airport is somewhat large and a little spread out. We had three wonderful days in this magnificent city , with superb weather . The hotel was really the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel just a few steps away from the center”
Reviews.Author: aquaman88
Reviews.Content: the hotel was a litle bit old and the room not very clean . when we arrived there was a bad smell throuout the room. however the breakfast was excellent ! the staf was very helpfull and polite ! the location was just perfect next to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: anartam
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel! I'm going to Rome annualy since 2008 and this is the third time I'm going to stay there. It's just a 10 minute walk to Piazza de Spagna, Fontana di Trevi, Via Del Corso and most popular settings in Rome. Rooms are large, very clean and staff were handful. There are two metro stations near the hotel. They offer you internet connection and breakfast is good enough. It's not easy to find a good hotel in Rome and this one here is just perfect. Not very expensive (it's not cheap though), offering very good accomodation and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “for a 3 star hotel very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: evisupergirl
Reviews.Content: it is about 30 minutes walking from fontana di trevi ,very old elevator, breakfast is satisfactory for a 3 star hotel,bright and clean rooms. generally good!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place worth going in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Elena268
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome and we really knew nothing about where and what in Rome.Thanks to our friend's recomendation we chose Ranieri hotel in September XX street.Very nice location next to the metro stations and bus stops.The service was good,breakfast quite substantional,the room was cosy though a bit small for us,the same for the bathroom.The barhroom amenities inluded a toothbrush,I found out that I left mine at home.The staff is extremely friendly and ready to help in all ways.We'll certainly come back to this homelike hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: kookamunga
Reviews.Content: The rooms are maintained well. The staff is super nice and helpful. The rooms are pretty basic but you shouldn't be spending to much time there anyway! The hotel is a bit far from sights and nightlife but the neighborhood is quiet and peaceful as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: phiggmart
Reviews.Content: We ended up booking Hotel Ranieri sort of as a last resort and couldn't have been more pleased. It is not absolutely central - but convenient enough - many things are walkable and we used cabs with a great deal of ease. Rooms are very clean and seem new. Fresh towels etc. every day. They were small as to be expected. The front desk was very helpful - giving us a tourist map, arranging for taxis and even arranging for a driver to go to Hadrian's Villa (a trip that our stateside travel agent thought might cost 500 euros but that the front desk arranged for 150). Breakfast was very good with many options. The little bar area is cute. The antique elevator might make you pause for a minute - but if it saved steps we were certainly up for it! the only thing to be aware of is that your cab drivers might take you all different ways because the street is one way near the hotel. but in spite of the fact there were many ways to get there - our cabs were all right around the same amount. This is a strong three star choice and one that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: scctrack
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what you have read. Rooms are quiet and good size. Walk to the metro is 10-15 min. 20 min to trevi fountain. Very filling and ample breakfast to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Darad
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, nice size room and a good buffet breakfast with plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Neat but not really central for tourist”
Reviews.Author: puneetxgulati
Reviews.Content: * Very well maintained, clean rooms * Very courteous and efficient staff * Not too close to station or metro or tourist places * Located in peaceful area

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Murphy_Sittard
Reviews.Content: hotel Ranieri is a nice place to stay when visiting rome. the rooms are of a decent size, have high ceilings and for Italian standards they serve a good breakfast. The beds are comfortable and cleaning is outstanding. the hotel is situated in a walking distance of all the mayor "attractions" A 20 minute walk will bring you to the Trevi fountains or the spanish stairway. If your not the walking type, Termini station is close by.. Via venti settembre is a busy road and during rushhours there's a lot of traffic, but indoors you don't even notice it. I missed a garden or a terrace to sit outside, but that's the only minus point I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CCousin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little jewel in Rome. Clean and neat with a very helpful staff. I had a group of 18 and we were all treated wonderfully. The location is not in the center of all the sites, but everything is within walking distance. It is close to the metro, if you wish to take it. I found the experience and price to be a great value.(Breakfast was nice and the times were within reason.)

Reviews.Title: “Bad location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: gattacas
Reviews.Content: The hotel says its close to the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain but you have to take the metro to get there. Not near any central squares or attractions and the area itself seems seedy; The rooms are very tiny, drab and poorly maintained. Definitely not a repeat option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a bit to walk to points of interest”
Reviews.Author: KOASweden
Reviews.Content: It's situated a bit outside the main center, but it's just a few minutes walk. Otherwise it's a nice place. The only thing is that there is a poor variety of bread for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice,clean hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret-law12
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel a lot! It is quite centrally positioned and the fact that there are many bus stations in front of the hotel helped us a lot because we used the buses more than the underground. It was very clean,cosy with perfect breakfast and very helpful staff.The room was a bit small but very functional.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ROGMUNSTER
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights over the weekend just passed and have to say I was extremely impressed. The room was of average size for Europe ( including UK and ROI) and was extremely comfortable and clean with a well stocked and reasonably priced Mini Bar. The Breakfast in the morning was excellent and the staff very polite and friendly. The area itself is very safe with a fantastic restaurant ( Cadorna) just to the back of the hotel and a fabulous ice cream parlour il carruso. For a bit more excitement Via Nazionale is about 7 minutes walk and a lot of the sites 15 to 20.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great staff, okay location.”
Reviews.Author: LESERLEE23
Reviews.Content: The reviews are exactly what I expected before staying at this hotel! The hotel is average and their staff are nice and helpful. The old school elevator was a bit of a pain. The wifi was free but a little slow. Location wise, it was a bit of a walk everywhere but to be honest, ALL OF THE TOURIST SPOTS IN ROME ARE SO CLOSE TO EACH OTHER! My boyfriend and I were literally able to walk everywhere we needed to and to visit the Vatican which was the furthest tourist spot you could possibly visit, all you had to do was take the bus which is right next to the hotel! The breakfast was OKAY, they had machines for their drinks, eggs, bacon, cereal, and bread. I think we got lucky with our room because we had a room at the very end of the hall which meant we were able to get a long hallway entrance to our bedroom unlike the others. The bathroom was nice with granite & water that heated up quickly. The cool part of the hotel that my boyfriend loved was their room keys haha. They are electronic so you didn't even need to take it out of your wallet to open the door. I would stay here again if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “What a absolute gem, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Aussienet
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to The Eternal City and have stayed at a variety of places, the Ranieri is the most definitely the best, it is situated on the via Venti Settembre and within a 15-20 minute walk to the main attractions, and within walking distance of the Termini and supermarkets. The hotel owners and staff are fantastic and extremely helpful, the rooms are not huge, but for Rome they are a good size and very clean, and quiet, the breakfast is great, eggs, bacon and a variety of cereals and cold items. the free internet is a big bonus as well. There is a bar area, where you can have a coffee or something stronger, or just chill out. I stayed there for 7 nights before going on to Sorrento for 9 nights then came back to the Ranieri for another 5, and was very happy to be be back there and welcomed by the staff as a returning friend. I can't find one fault with this hotel and another big plus< an elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Little Hotel Just Outside of Touristy Area”
Reviews.Author: STemple17
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights and we overall had a good experience. The lobby was very polished looking and there was a small reception desk when you come in along with the old-style gated elevator. We arrived 4 hours before check-in and our room was not ready. So we were told to leave our luggage in a side room so we could walk around until check in time at 1pm. The woman at the front desk was very nice. The elevator was kind of cramped. Only 3 people (or 2 with luggage) could fit in there at any given time. We were on the third floor so we usually just walked down but took the elevator up. The room was small but clean. Shower quality was excellent. Bathroom had a little bit of a musty odor but was not unbearable by any means. Our window faced the inner courtyard so the room was quiet for sleeping Safe provided worked well for valuables. Cool ceiling.Complimentary breakfast every morning was god: scrambled eggs, bacon, tomato, cheeses, yogurt, cereals, danishes/croissants. Coffee and juice machines. Front desk booked our bus tour for us, which was helpful. And recommended places to eat. Overall a pleasant experience. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BarbandNeal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ranieri is a clean hotel, at good value, and located well for visiting Rome and all it's sights. I am an American engineer and I have been traveling on business throughout the US for 25 years - staying in good quality Hilton, Marriott, and Holiday Inn type hotels. Visited Rome with my wife, but, had a budget to protect. The Ranieri was very clean. Housekeeping cleaned the room immaculately daily, new bed linens daily. Bathroom modern, clean and comfortable w/ 120 VAC 60 Hz available. Nice little bar area to have a glass of wine at a good price, or to get a cappuccino or expresso. Breakfast daily, eggs, bacon, fresh danishes, cereals, and with an assortment of cold cuts and fresh bread or rolls to make a sandwich to pack for lunch while roming the city. the Metro (subway) is approximately 5 blocks away - a nice, easy walk. The Metro is convenient for going to the Vatican and Saint Peters Bascilica/Sisteen Chaple. Youcan even take the Metro to the Spanish Steps area. Otherwise, my wife and I preferred to walk most everywhere and we loved it. So that you may compare yor ability to do the same, we are in our late fourties, approaching 50 yrs age. We are fit, but i wouldnt say we are athletes. This is definately do-able for the average middle-aged couple. And, it is safe to walk from the Ranieri to all locations. People say a 4 Star European Hotel is comparable to a 3 star in the USA, but, the Hotel Ranieri is quaint, and every bit as clean and comfy as a 4 star hotel in the states. Granted, the rooms are a little small, but, so are most of the rooms in Rome from what i understand, and, they are still totally manageable. We did a lot a research on hotels before booking - it was a bit stressful. Originally, we tried to stay close to the Spanish Steps. We easily saved $500 for the week by staying just a little further away at the Ranieri, and, we didnt miss a click by doing so, and, perhaps we even enjoyed ourselves more. There are at least a dozen resturants to choose from right around the block from the Ranieri - all pretty good and reasonably priced. A great way to end the day. The metro is easy to use, and in-expensive. We felt well located at the Ranieri. We saw it all. This hotel is highly recommended! Hey, if you have a few extra hundred bucks, maybe you'll want to stay closer to the Spanish Steps, but, you can save a handsome sum or re-direct this amount to other spends with what you save by staying at the Hotel Ranieri.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay at Hotel Ranieri again!”
Reviews.Author: AKarabin
Reviews.Content: We expected the hotel rooms to be cramped and they were. There was an awful smell in our room (possibly from mold or a dead animal), which was dingy. The hotel staff would not move us to a less smelly room. The hotel occupies most of an old apartment building and it appears that the rooms in the front of the hotel were more cheerful and less depressing than our rooms (which were in the back of the building). The breakfast room was adequate but the food was lousy and the coffee was awful, it came from a machine and did not taste great. After wonderful coffee in the rest of Italy, this was a real letdown. Some of the front desk staff was friendly, but others were surly. The area where the hotel is located is kind of strange...but luckily there were a few good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here for Roma Trip. Average Hotel....Very Nice Front Desk Tho”
Reviews.Author: joeandloren314
Reviews.Content: Overall I am mixed about this stay. Hotel wasnt in that great of a Location as we expected. It would have been nice to have alot of cafe's and nice to shop at but within 5 to 10 minute walk you can get that. Hotel the Front Desk was very friendly and the Antique Elevator was lovely. Breakfast was decemt. Hotel Lobby was decorated nicely but our room seemed to need some updates.I read on here that the hotel was updated and thats one reason why we picked it but our room was a little disappointing. Maybe all roooms werent like this but ours was a little bit off the beaten path. We were on 4th floor and Internet reception was horrible. Maybe if we were closer to ground level it would have been better. (who knows??) Hotel was close to the Termini Station is one good plus. Overall if this hotel was a little bit closer to the center of everything it would have been nicer. Just about 5 to 10 minute walk to alot of cafes and hangouts. Trevi Fountain 15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Dunnedg
Reviews.Content: Super little hotel. The whole hotel has been recently modernised and the rooms though not large are well planned so dont feel cramped. Plenty of storage space etc. Everything is clean. Nice breakfast room and adequate breakfast. Small bar area with computers with internet access for free. We were able to print off boarding cards by e-mailing them to the hotel and the receptionist printed them off for us. Excellent and very helpful staff. We have stayed in a more central hotel but we dont mind walking and 20 mins took us to the Trevi or Spanish steps. Very safe area. A lot of government depts so loads of police around. Some lovely little restaurants within 5 mins walking to cover all budgets (3 or 4 in the street behind which runs parallel with the hotel). We had a small problem on the day we were leaving as the street was closed off because of a protest being held outside the Ministry of Economics. A taxi could not get to the hotel but the owner and the receptionist were excellent help and managed to arrange a taxi to pick us up in the street behind. Really nice people and have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “great location, many extras, wonderful room & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jojam
Reviews.Content: We started our ten day vacation here and it was a perfect place. Close to the Termini, Rome's main train station, the Metro stop at the Republica Plaza, and many great restaurants, churches and historic sites. Our room was spacious, clean and quiet. The staff is helpful and the internet is free. There is also a lovely lounge/bar area in case you arrive before check-in time.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Hotel, Good Location, Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: PennyRon
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from Rome, hotel within easy walking distance of the Termini Station, a must if travelling into the city by public transport. The area outside the station is very busy. There are plenty of restaurants and shops in the termini area and surrounding streets. Lots to do and see all within walking distance of the hotel. Breakfast provided English and continental, tea and coffee, juice and cereals available. Unfortunately no tea and coffee provided in rooms, and no kettle either. We read the reviews and took our own. There is a large SIR supermarket a couple of streets away where we bought water, snacks and drinks much cheaper than using the mini bar. The hotel has wireless iternet which is great and the hotel staff are friendly and helpful. Restaurants in Rome are mainly pizzarias or pasta restaurants and the hotel has no evening restaurant. There are lots of McDonalds in Rome and also a Burger King. Transport from Fumincino Airport, which is the main Rome airport was either by the Leonardo Express directly to Termini Station euros 14 one way or by bus which is stationed just outside the airport return fare euros 15 which is a lot cheaper and takes about 1hr 10 mins. Leave enough time to get to the airport as the traffic is very busy, and the airport is vast. Beware as there is another bus which goes to Roma Centro which is not near the termini station - costs only euro 6 but you will have to get the metro to the termini station only euro 1 by metro but inconvenient. Bus touts will sell you a ticket telling you its central but will not get you where you want to go. Hotel is within walking distance of all major attractions would say the hotel is in a good location, we had a large room, although was very dark courtyard facing, very quiet which was good, and very clean. The hotel has a lounge /bar and computer facility, a room to store your bags when you leave which was free, very good if you have a later flight as we did. Roads in Rome were extremely busy and you have to use the crossings with confidence as they will not stop unless you walk accross, some do not have traffic lights. Sight seeing buses hop on hop off round the city, sometimes quicker to walk though due to traffic, also so much to see round every corner. Would recommed you go early to the Vatican/Colliseum as very busy and long queues. We had a great time and would recommend this hotel and amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - wrong price”
Reviews.Author: DariOlio
Reviews.Content: I know Rome hotels so I was not disappointed with this one. Service is really fine but the price 2hi for the quality. Nice neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: mamapatti2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our first trip to Rome and it did not disappoint. From the moment we were picked up at the airport til the time we checked out, everyone was professional and friendly. We were able to check in early and drop our luggage off in our room and set out exploring. We BMWed it everywhere from Ranieri - bus, metro, walk! Everything was definitely within walking distance if you don't mind hoofing it a little. The bus stops right outside the hotel made it very convenient to get around as well. The staff offered a lot of great suggestions for restaurants close by - the best being da Vincenzo's, about a 3 minute walk away. The room was extremely well maintained, the bathroom very modern and super clean and the bed was the most comfortable one we had our entire trip. The breakfast was limited in choice and seriously lacking in fresh fruit. However, we asked for our morning capuccino from the wait staff and they brought it hot and fresh from the lounge - the dispenser coffee was iffy at best. We will most definitely be recommending Hotel Ranieri to friends! Thank you to everyone at Hotel Ranieri!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cupcakeGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 days earlier this month. The room was not a bad size although very dark as the window looked out onto another part of the hotel and the sky was not visible at all. The safe was a hit or a miss and when leaving we had to get the receptionist to open it with a key to retrieve our passports (this seemed to be a big problem for the staff, very unhelpful!) Room was cleaned daily to a high standard. The breakfast was very disappointing, I was looking forward to a lovely cup of coffee in Rome, it was not to be found here, a machine which gave out a grey subatance which was cold and digusting. A tip regarding the taxis in Rome, get a price before you get in and ALWAYS wear your seat belt - I thought I was going to die on the way to the airport!! The hotel was not as close to the Spanish Steps etc as we were lead to believe. Would not return to this hotel, or indeed Rome, people are very rude and not at all friendly and would rob you blind!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, not as close as thought to major sites, staff nice apart from one!”
Reviews.Author: LauraFGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from our stay in Hotel Ranieri for 4nights wth husband, mum and sister. Hotel was very good, rooms were adequate size with mini bar which was not too expensive considering what you pay anywhere else. Breakfast was limited but enough. Location was ok, maybe we found it farther away due to the heat we had to walk in to get to many sites. August really is too hot for a a sightseeing holiday. Good airconditioning in the rooms however! We therefore spent quite a lot on taxi's. Staff in hotel were lovely apart from one man on checkout. Whatever you do, do not fill in a different mini bar sheet per day - even though it clearly states to fill one out for each day you stay. The older man on checkout was so so rude. He had arms in the air, shouting, all very much a big hassle for him! Oh and then when you pay and he has to actually give you change, dont know how he copes, such hard work! However we did encounter many rude people elsewhere in Rome so should have expected this. Working within the hospitality industry in a city which relies heavily on tourists, you would expect much better customer service. Dont get me started on the taxi drivers! We enjoyed our stay in Rome however the extreme heat and the rude romans we encountered did spoil what could have been the perfect city break!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little too out of the way”
Reviews.Author: EFox917
Reviews.Content: Two teenaged girls and I stayed five nights. It was my first trip to Rome, so I couldn't judge distances by the map. The hotel is very clean and quiet. The room was spacious enough for the three of us (3 twin beds). The elevator goes up the middle of the building and gives visitors a sense of what it's like to live in a Roman apartment. The staff was usually quite helpful and spoke English fluently. I reduced the service points because the WiFi internet service on the 5th floor was spotty at best. Occasionally the signal was strong, but usually it wasn't. Sometimes we went out in the hall to get a better signal, but we didn't find out about the lounge on the ground floor until the last day. Although the service at breakfast was professional and pleasant, the food and coffee were terrible. Canned fruit salad. A machine that produced a grey substance when you pressed the capuccino button. The hotel was a 10 - 15 min. walk to the metro or to the Spanish Stairs. Had it been more centrally located we would have been able to rest in the middle of the day after lunch. In the future, I'll choose a hotel more centrally located closer to a metro and/or the Spanish Stairs. Had we not had three (out of 4) negative experiences with dishonest cab drivers, we might have been more willing to take cabs back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: mariept
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and good sized for Rome. Breakfast was included and amazing. We opted to have a driver pick us up at the airport and bring us to the hotel. The hotel arranged the whole thing. They have two computers that are free to use in the lounge. It is about a 20 minute walk to the Trevi fountain. The best gelato of the trip was around the corner from this hotel, I Caruso. Lots of great little family restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Walter967
Reviews.Content: Nicely located close to one of the tourist bus stops, city bus lines, and metro. Rooms decorated with attention and high quality bedding. Free internet access was appreciated. Morning breakfast was a lovely start to a day of sightseeing. Quality of service excellent and price very reasonable considering the location, service and quality of rooms. Will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Monteironeto
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and spacy room, very good location, good neighborhood with nice restaurants. Will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for it's price and pleasant for any traveller”
Reviews.Author: tyurin
Reviews.Content: Very convinient location (near of all sights)! Breakfast is not variety, but it"s more than enough. Coffee from coffee machine is sucks, but you can ask for it a waiter (nuance - waiters don't speak english, so learn couple words in italian) and he/she gives you another one. Rooms are not so large, but for traveller, who wants to walk and walk, absorbing Roman spirit, it's not really important, IMHO. The district is cosy and stilly with much trattorias (my favorite was "il golfo" via Raffaele Cadorna, 24/26 - delicios fish, great service, pleasant prices; gellateria is not far from it, i can't remember the name, via collina - homemade ice-cream, IMHO the best in Rome; "ristorante 101" - delicios meat, via flavia) I reccomend this hotel! Have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EldoradoEurope
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this cozy hotel in Rome for a week in January. I was very happy with my choice. The staff was very helpful and nice. They always greeted you and gave you their time. The room was great with a beautiful view, extremely high ceiling, TV and a clean bathroom. The room also had plenty of closet space. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet very much. They had muesli, cereals, yogurt, bread, coffee, tea, grapefruit/pineapple/red orange/orange juice, pastries, cookies, pie, cheese, ham, tomato etc. There was a safe in the room, but in order to activate it you needed to use your credit card. That was unusual. I know that some people here haven't been happy with the lift, but I thought it was charming (maybe a little old fashioned). The cocktail room had a chic bohemian decor. There they also had 2 computers with internet access + newspapers and brochures. The bathrooms in the lobby had a classic ballroom-like swanky design. The only comment on the negative side is that the fire alarm light in the room kept flashing every 5 seconds. The same thing happened with the door. I mean, once you were in the room you had to push the "do not disturb" button on the door (this instruction was on the keycard). Once you pushed that button it turned red and started to flash every 3 seconds. This didn't bother me during daytime, but once you closed the curtains and turned off the lights, it felt like you were in a disco! All in all, I would recommend this hotel to all my friends travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a good location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel1713
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Rome for business or vacation. My husband was in Rome on business, and I met him there to spend some vacation time as well. We travel a fair amount, and we have stayed in really nice hotels, and some not-so-nice ones. We were very happy with this place, it was a perfect little boutique hotel for our time in Rome. It had charm and character, and good value for the money. Service - Everyone at the front desk, specifically Adriano and Antonio, were extremely helpful and friendly. They were always waiting with a friendly "Ciao" or "Bonjourno"! They arranged car service for us to and from the airport, they helped my husband with taxis to work every day, and they even recommended restaurants in the area and called to make reservations for us. There is no restaurant at the hotel, but there is a cute little hotel bar in the back that you can always get a drink at. And they do serve you breakfast every day. It is a small continental-type selection, but everything was good and always tied us over until lunch. Try the red orange juice - it's yum! Room - The room is not huge, but it was perfectly fine. Everything is impeccably clean, and they clean your room and give you new towels every day. The bed is a bit on the hard side, but we thought it was very comfortable and slept great every night. We didn't spend much time in the room, but when we did we felt very comfortable in there. There is free wi-fi in the room. Location - The hotel is in a perfectly good location, unless you don't want to walk at all. But Rome is a walking city anyway - that is what you are supposed to do! Everywhere is so beautiful, we loved walking to and from attractions and restaurants every day and night. Hotel Ranieri is approximately 15-20 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain/Pantheon/Piazza Navona. The Colesseum and Trastevere were a bit further, maybe 30 minute walk or so. But everything from the Trevi Fountain was easy to get to, all easily walkable, or jump in a cab if you don't want to walk. The only thing that is a bit further and may require transportation other than walking was the Vatican. There really isn't anything to see right near the hotel, but again, it is an easy walk to many attractions and sites. The area around the hotel isn't too exciting, but we always felt very safe in the area, even me when I was walking by myself. There is a good little pizza place that we got pre-dinner pizza at a few times on the way into the city center, and that is a stone's throw away from the hotel. Stay at Hotel Ranieri, you will be happy you did. You get what you pay for, and you will not be disappointed with the value you get there for the money you spend.

Reviews.Title: “would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: JONESPRESTON
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very helpful. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The area was very good, plenty of restaurants nearby. no complaints what so ever. Drinks in the hotel bar were reasonably priced . Would definately return and recommend to anyone visiting this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: kalmochan
Reviews.Content: just arrived back from a weekend break with my husband and friends at ths hotel. it was a great hotel the staff are great and very helpful especially when our pre booked taxi did not arrive to take us back to the airport . The receptionist kept ringing them for us and then arranged another taxi which got us to the airport with 5 mins spare(the taxi company was www.rome-transfer.eu do not use them) the rooms although ours was a bit on the small size (ours friends were luckier and had a bath and balcony) were immaculate and cleaned every day,the breakfast was a continental one but there was plenty and it was always nice. I would definetly recomend this hotel it was great value for money ,the location was good but the staff were excellent very friendly and helpful. Rome is fabulous and the trip to the Vatican Museum which I prebooked with the vatican official site was amazing and worth every penny. My only advice is to take comfortable shoes as you will need them

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Kits10706
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ranieri was exactly what we wanted. They were able to accomidate 3 rooms for 3 couples at a very competitive price. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. There was renovations being done on the exterior of the hotel which made it a little difficult to find but still we found it. The hotel is very modern. The rooms all had air conditioning, televisions, mini fridge/bar and private bathrooms. There are multiple stairs but they have an elevator so it's not a problem. They have a bar by reception, which we used almost daily to meet the family and have a pre dinner beer or wine. Thanks Carlo!!!! They also offer free internet access. Breakfast was good: ham, cheese, salami, croissants, cereal, yogurt. With a variety of different juices and breads. My favorite was the espresso machine. It has cappuchino, espresso, american coffee, plus more, all with a push of a button. The staff was friendly, offered great dinner suggestions and were very helpful with transportation advice. The location was great. It was away from the very touristy parts of town which is exactly what we wanted. A few blocks away is the metro station, bus is across the street, and shops and restaurants all very close. We walked to the Trevi Fountain, Borghese Park, and Spanish Steps easily. Termini station is also a few blocks away. I would definitely stay there again and would reccommend to anyone. My only negative: There is no clock in the room. We had no idea what time it was the entire time we were there. So my only suggestion would be to get a clock for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mussey
Reviews.Content: Speaking to people who had been on short breaks to Rome, they all said "stay central". The choice of central sites was quite long. Given that we were only there for 2 nights (3 days) we didn't need much in way of luxury, but many of the reviews of hotels under £200 were worryingly "mixed". However, going up to just over the £200 mark for 2 nights, we found univerally good reviews for this hotel. Having just returned, the reviews were accurate. Nice hotel, good site, just outside the main tourist area, but we walked to all the sites. However the Vatican, being across the river was the furthest away, but still walkable if you are fairly able. The rooms are small neat and tidy as is the bathroom, and despite bing on a main road, we got good nights sleep on both nights. An added bonus was that 2 of the reception team, though of Italian parentgae had been bought up in England and Australia respecyively, so were word perfect in our language. Breakfast was decent,--croissant, pasties and cereal, but if thats not enough, pleny of small snack bars nearby. Rome itself--wonderfull, great sites, nice mainly small shops, thankfully different to the generic high streets in UK. Eating--well as expected, more exensive in the main piazzas -especially the drinks--but some side street cafes just off the main sites very reasonable and if you order beer and wine for instance, you get snacks for free nearly everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay, will return”
Reviews.Author: hey47
Reviews.Content: After a few years we recently returned to the Ranieri. To our surprise we found that the general areas of the Hotel had been remodeled and improved. The old grey entrance has completely changed and the reception which used to be on the second floor has been relocated to the ground floor. Also there is a new breakfast room which looks great. Staff was still as friendly as before. We had asked for a quiet room so we were at the back and had no view at all but the room was nicely fitted and very clean (we liked the Bang&Olufsen TV set in our room!). The free Wi-Fi worked fine in the lounge area but not in our room. We believe the hotel has a good price/quality ratio and we will certainly return. The hotel is in the city center so parking was difficult. They did arrange for someone to pick up our rental and valet park it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: SMMcL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Ranieri twice now and can definitely say I would book to stay there again for a trip to Rome. It's a basic hotel but with comfy rooms, clean bathrooms and very friendly staff. I can't praise the staff highly enough, the concierges especially are polite, extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast is good with a range of breads, sweet pastries, cereals, cold meat, cheeses, juices, coffees, teas. It's only a few minutes walk from the Piazza Repubblica and the Fontana Dell'Acqua Felice. As such, if looking for an English Mass in Rome is also very convenient, with an American congregation located in Santa Susanna, across the road from the fountain. It's about a 15 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain (if that) and the same to Santa Maria Maggiore. There is a number 62 bus about 150m down the Via XX Settembre from the hotel which goes directly to St Peter's Square. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends for a value for money place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A little dull on arrival”
Reviews.Author: AudreyHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: Disappointed on arrival as we were "overbooked" at the nearby Medici Hotel - never a good start to a break you have been looking forward to in a City you have never visited before! So mood was not good when entering the room, which was facing the inner courtyard on the first floor with hardly any daylight (a bit like an inside cabin on a cruise ship which we would never book!). However, we ventured out to the city after a quick freshen up - and found ourselves hitting the main government building almost immediately down the road with obvious VIPs visiting. Rome really is an amazing city but you need good walking sandals/trainers to feel comfortable for the many many miles you need to walk! Word of warning - you need tickets for all travel prior to hopping on buses & trains that you can obtain at the local Termini newsagent for 4 euros giving all day travel. Best value was the open air bus tours where you can hop on and off to see all the attractions for around 16 euros each, over 24 hours - and provides a good rest! Back to the dark room in the evening to freshen up again (good bathroom but wobbly shower) before dinner, and visited the restaurant around the corner (opposite the Medici) for an average meal. Best restaurant of the 4 days was the rooftop at the Hotel Forum (recommended before we went) where we hit on a special evening promoting Soave wine by the vineyard owner - excellent food and wine! Breakfast next morning was as we expected - a very fair continental help yourself type, but plenty! The British don't like them because they do tend to be aimed for the sweet tastes, but cheese and ham was available. Friendly and efficient service available if required. Returned home to watch Roman Holiday DVD with Gregory Peck & Audrey Hepburn to relive our memories of the wonderful sites we saw - not quite so busy in those days though! Debbie & Dereck - Hertfordshire

Reviews.Title: “Ranieri in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Jackaleen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Ranieri 5 or 6 times over the last 13 years and have always found it to be a good bargain. It is clean and the staff is courteous and helpful. Luana and Diego take care of their guests and Carlo makes a divine cappuciino!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Hosts Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: gasketman
Reviews.Content: Although when first arriving tired, this hotel looked not so good...you have to go up one flight off street level to the front desk....but....my wife and I can't say enough about how gracious the front desk conciere named "Diego" was to us!! So welcoming and spoke excellent English...sold us tickets for the Metro and helped make our stay so pleasurable gave us maps, gave us use of a computer and internet connection.......All the people at the front desk couldn't do enough to make our stay so wonderful...the neighborhood was not far from the Piazza De La Republica, so it was safe and pleasant. Breakfast in the morning was so nice...made me a special cappucino, cheeses and sweet rolls.....rooms were always clean and we would highly recommend this hotel for people who really just want a room that's clean to sleep in with pleasant help after a long day out in Rome...certainly not the Ritz, but more than adequate!!! Booked this hotel through our travel agent. David

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel22
Reviews.Content: We stay at Hotel Ranieri for 4 nights. Unfortunately on the second day, money was taken from our room. The hotel took no responsibility for this loss even after promising to give us one night free. Also, the location is not very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location not that great”
Reviews.Author: Chil75
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very friendly staff and standard european rooms. The bathroom in the room was clean and a nice size. The breakfast in the morning is fine with bread, pastries, meats, cheeses and cereal. The only downside to this hotel is the location as its a bit of a walk to any of the popular areas of Rome except Via Veneto. A good price for the room you get, but given how hard it is to get a cab in Rome during peak hours I'd think about staying somewhere else - if you don't mind the location then this is a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not well located”
Reviews.Author: Buro72
Reviews.Content: We stayed a Hotel Ranieri between 28 September and 5 October 2006. The room was clean and tidy with in house safe and trouser press! We had satellite TV and a comfortable bed as well. The bathroom appered reasonably new with plenty of fresh towels. The shower was over the bath with shower curtain. The staff spoke good english and were friendly and courteous. My only main criticism is the Hotels location. Whilst it close enough to the main train station, it is a lengthy walk to any of the main tourist attractions (and I love to walk)! It takes about forty minutes brisk walking to Vatican City, twenty minutes to Trevi Fountain, thirty minutes to Colusseum etc. Breakfast was okay with a selection of pasteries, cheeses and meats however the coffee was terrible. Get out of the Hotel and get an expresso from a nearby bar!! I would probably try and find somewhere different next time and closer to the old town. In my opinion, the Hotel offers reasonable value for money (we paid 152 Euro per night)

Reviews.Title: “Ranieri”
Reviews.Author: 12***h
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Rome I stayed at the Ranieri with a friend. It was OK. The room was fine, very clean, quiet aircon, plenty of hot water, quiet rooms, if a bit small, and basic, though it did have a trouser press! The staff sounded like they were from London until you heard them speak Italian. Somehow it didn't quite seem like a hotel though. The building seems to be shared business premises and rooms start on the third floor with the reception on the 2nd floor up large communal staircase. When you first arrive you reach an intercom, by a lift, and have to buzz up for further information. Rooms were grouped in floors through another locked door and we were only allowed one key. I think my opinion was swayed by the fact a friend stayed round the corner for 10E per night more in 4 star luxury with roof terrace. Its not bad at all but next time Id stay nearer the centre or old town, we did start caling it Fawlty Towers before we left.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Schmidt-Haus
Reviews.Content: My wife won a sales competition at work and the prize was a free weekend stay in Rome. Initially we were offered other hotels but after looking at the reviews on this site we refused them! The travel agency then suggested the Ranieri. I was a little wary after reading some of the reviews but I can honestly say we had a lovely stay. The room was small however you don't travel all the way to Rome to stay in your room (if you do I suggest you need therapy!). The bed was comfortable and the linen fresh and clean. Our room overlooked a courtyard and as a result was very quiet. The air conditioning was amazing! It was very efficient and virtually silent, the best I've ever come across - if only all a/c units were like this! As the temperature was still reaching the 30s C this was very much appreciated. The bathroom looked to have a new suite installed and everything worked as expected. The towels also looked new and were clean. The television worked fine with a wide selection of channels (only CNN in english). There was a safe in the wardrobe which was free to use. The major plus point of this hotel are the staff, they were all so friendly! Not all of them spoke perfect english but it was never a problem as there were quite a few who did and were able to step in as required. The breakfast was good, fresh coffee (cappuchino if wanted!) would be brought to your table and there was a selection of cereals, bread, cheese, deli meats, etc. In summary I would say that in this case, small was most definitely beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel...but location is not convenient”
Reviews.Author: SoCalFamily4
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at the Ranieri at the first part of a two week trip to Rome, Florence, Venice and Tuscany with my husband and two teenage daughters. We didn't make a final decision to go to Italy until April due to schedule conflicts, so we didn't have a wide choice of hotels by that time. We spent the first two nights at another hotel in Rome which had been highly recommended (Hotel Modigliani, which we loved) and then moved to the Ranieri for our remaining nights in Rome. We were somewhat disappointed by our experience at the hotel. True, the hotel was a good value (250 Euros for a quad room), the staff was nice and helpful, breakfast was decent, and my daughters liked the free Internet service. However, our quad room was the smallest of all the hotel rooms we experienced in Italy. My major complaint about the hotel is the location. It really is "off the beaten path" as other reviewers have commented, and is not easily accessible to Rome's major locations by foot. We ended up taking cabs at Euro 6-10 for the four of us to reach a major destination or subway station. By contrast, we were able to walk nearly everywhere from our first hotel. All in all, not a bad place...but I would not return nor recommend it to others. Particularly for a family like mine with teenage daughters, I would stay closer to restaurants, shops, and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome or Europe for that matter. I read so many reviews and other hotels were already booked being that the end of May start of Jun is high season for tourist. Of course you can be unsure about reviews and opinions and hope for the best. I do have to say I was very happy with my choice here.. this hotel is clean, comfortable, the bathrooms are clean, great hot water, quiet and above all the staff was the absolute friendiest we encountered on our trip. They went above and beyond to take care of our needs, provided helpful info., made wonderful suggestions & resrvs. at great places to eat and the breakfast was perfect!!! The owner even helped my husband with an amazing fix to a converter so that he could charge his phone. They all speak english. I would definately recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family. This was a great start to a great trip. It was a quiet hotel, we faced the inside not the street, some had mentioned it was a bit off the beaten path so hence more quiet. We did cab it everywhere ~6-10 E for 4 ppl., plus the hotel would call an immediate cab for us everytime. It is a bit of a walking dist. to most of the sights, not bad if you don't mind walking, but if you do-take a cab or bus. Not far from the train station. Honestly, after walking around the Spanish Steps and Trevi, I can see why those hotels might be a bit noisy b/c the traffic and tourists continue pretty late into the night. Thanks Hotel Ranieri, we hope to be back VERY soon!!

Reviews.Title: “The Price was Right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thought the Hotel Ranieri was a nice place to stay. It was about 100 euro a night, including breakfast. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was well stocked. We happened to be there at the same time as a large student group, so the group pretty much dominated the breakfast time from 830-10am doing homework and giving presentations while the rest of the guests searched for a place to enjoy a morning cappucino. I think that's just the luck of the draw and Hotel Ranieri cannot be blamed. Otherwise, the location was really good. A touch off the beaten path, but that allowed us to eat at many of the wonderful local ristorantes. It's always a good sign when you are the only out of towner in the place.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: KenSevenoaks
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel based on Trip Advisor ratings and were not disappointed. The staff were welcoming and helpful and the room was clean. The position of the hotel was ideal, close to 'the sites', on a good bus route, near to the main station but far enough away for it not to be too busy. In the evening there was a selection of reasonably priced restaurants/cafes in the side streets at the rear of the hotel. Hotel provided free internet access. Criticisms: 1. Warm coffee at first breakfast 2. No tea/coffee making facilities in room 3. Room adjacent to reception subject to late night noise. 4. External appearance of hotel poor (on second storey of an old building. Summary: Ignore criticisms - we enjoyed the holiday (weather in Feb was ideal) and would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: vogaits
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel and a great value - E135/night including buffet breakfast. Rooms and bathrooms (with tubs!) were spacious by European standards, and immaculate. Our rooms (103 and 104) overlooked the busy street, but the traffic died down by 11pm and we had no problem sleeping. With the exception of one woman serving guests at breakfast, who was truly rude, staff were gracious. Hotel is a bit out-of-the-way (about 20 - 25 minutes walk to most popular tourist attractions) but convenient to main train station and several bus lines stop right in front of the hotel. Restaurant La Lampada, just around the corner, was great.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel very reasonably priced staff really helpful and very friendly cleanliness of whole hotel was of a very high standard would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive but Gracious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Grazie to all the Ranieri staff! Their rates are excellent but their graciousness is not compromised. They're also within a short bus ride of the center of town (piazza venezia) or a 20 minute walk. The rooms are nothing fancy, but definitely clean and well kept -- I would however recommend a double, as the single was somewhat cramped. The staff is courteous and helpful (I changed rooms twice!) in old Italian style. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: margeor
Reviews.Content: In August 2005, my husband and I have stayed at Ranieri Hotel. The word that descript the hotel is perfect! Great location, friendly staff. Our room, not too big and fancy but very clean and comfortable with very good a/c! Hotel is an easy centrally located place. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chiplovesdana
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by prior posts, the staff went out of their way to help in arranging tours, gave us some helpful hints and Luanna spoke excellent English. This is a quaint hotel, nothing fufu, just a couple of blocks from the bus terminal. You can also catch Bus 62 right in front of the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel when on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked to stay at the hotel giotto flavia, but because the water was out there, where very kindly put up in the hotel ranieri across the street. We are world travellers and have stayed in all types of places, so know that this review is coming from an experienced european traveller. Hotel Ranieri is an excellent value. After entering through an old lobby, you go via elevator to the hotel lobby itself. It is small, but very clean and the staff are superb. They speak excellent english and are very, very helpful in arranging tours, making dinner reservations, etc. The rooms are small, but very clean, with excellent bathrooms, minibars, and safes. If you are on a budget or just looking for an easy centrally located place to stay in rome for a few days, this is an excellent choice. There are no fancy lounges, no chocolate mints on the pillows - just very clean, safe rooms with an excellent staff, good breakfast in the morning, and a great location. My wife and I would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: January
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in this hotel twice. Once back in 1999 and again during our honeymoom in 2003. We were not originally going to stay in this hotel for our honeymoon because my husband is "frugal" and had gotten a deal with the travel agent on a hotel included with our flight fare. We arrived in Rome and walked into the hotel and it looked like a cross between the movies "Cacoon" and "The Shining!" We left a immediately and went the Ranieri with no reservations. The hotel staff were wonderful! They still had us in their computer from our previous stay and gave us a beautiful suite with champagne for no additional charge! The Ranieri saved my honeymoon! Even though the hotel is a bit far from the subway stations, it is well worth it! I love the spiral staircase and the staff are great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hospitality ,was there with my 2 year old daughter and they accomodated me with fresh milk everyday for her. Each room has a safe to use free of charge, airconditioning that works and the mini bar prices are reasonable. Breakfast could be improved as the hotel is a bit pricey(as all hotels in Rome All in all Mid Priced Hotel (Rome Standards) with all the necessary facilities for your visit to Rome

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ranieri Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Via Venti Settembre 43, 00187 Rome, Italy
